Description: Small grey marbled cardboard box labelled 'burnt papyrus' containing approximately 40 charred fragments of papyri, most extremely small, the largest 5 x 2 cm. Clear traces of demotic are visible.
Curator's comments: Previously unregistered. Identified in 2009 in trays of miscellaneous material that had been moved into store room M4. Being studied by Kim Ryholt (Copenhagen).
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: carbonised, fragmented, fragile Black ink: visible with infra-red Red ink: ? Mount Details: Marbled Box: Box: purpose made with Plastazote padding Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: E
